Sarah Chan, Business Administration at NUSLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 01 Jul 2019Hi there anon! I recently answered a similar question here, you should check it out: https://seedly.sg/questions/i-have-been-working-on-a-plan-to-achieve-financial-independence-but-it-hasn-t-been-going-too-well-anyone-has-any-advice?aid=16497I think the first step to personal finance is to sort out your current financial status according to the 5 verticals in personal finance. For starters, check out these 2 articles!https://blog.seedly.sg/read-me-first-your-personal-finance-journey-starts-with-this-article/https://blog.seedly.sg/beginner-series-tips-seedly-money-framework/Next, you should take a course of action based on the 5 verticals of personal finance.Income: adopt our Seedly 50-30-20 salary allocation modelExpenses: track them with the Seedly AppSavings & Debt: pick a high interest savings accountInsurance: get life & health insurance at the very leastInvestment: start reading up about investment options and make a financial planManaging your personal finance isn't that daunting, you just have to begin somewhere. I hope I've brought you to that somewhere! You can read up more on personal finance on our Seedly blog, everything is FOC :) All the very best to your personal finance journey!0 comments1
